Idiom (Lao): ເຂົາຊົມໄກ ແຕ່ບໍ່ເບິ່ງໃກ້
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To admire something from afar without understanding it deeply.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They praise something without really knowing it.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from Lao proverbs highlighting perspective and understanding.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Lao): /kʰǎw som kǎj tɛː bòː bəŋ kàj/
First Example Sentence: ລາວເປັນຄົນທີ່ເຂົາຊົມໄກ ແຕ່ບໍ່ເບິ່ງໃກ້ຈິງໆ.
Second Example Sentence: ບາງຄົນຊອບຂອງຝຣັ່ງເພາະເຂົາຊົມໄກ ແຕ່ບໍ່ເບິ່ງໃກ້.
Third Example Sentence: ໃນຊີວິດຕ້ອງຮຽນຮູ້ທີ່ຈະເບິ່ງໃກ້ ບໍ່ແມ່ນແຕ່ເຂົາຊົມໄກ.

Idiom (Lao): ກິນເຂົ້າບໍ່ກິນນ້ຳ
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To refuse something essential, showing stubbornness or arrogance.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They reject what they need out of pride.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: From Lao rural life, symbolizing the refusal to follow practical wisdom.
First Example Sentence: ລາວເປັນຄົນກິນເຂົ້າບໍ່ກິນນ້ຳ ເຮັດໃຫ້ເປັນທຸກລຳບາກ.
Second Example Sentence: ເດັກນ້ອຍບາງຄົນດື້ຫຼາຍ ກິນເຂົ້າບໍ່ກິນນ້ຳ.
Third Example Sentence: ຊີວິດຄົນບໍ່ຄວນເປັນແບບກິນເຂົ້າບໍ່ກິນນ້ຳ.

Idiom (Lao): ຈັບປາສອງມື
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Verb phrase with numerical object modifier
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To try to do two things at once and fail at both.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They can’t handle two tasks simultaneously.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from Lao fishing metaphors about greed and overreaching.
First Example Sentence: ຖ້າເຮັດຫຼາຍຢ່າງພ້ອມກັນ ກໍເຫມືອນຈັບປາສອງມື.
Second Example Sentence: ລາວຈັບປາສອງມື ເລີຍບໍ່ສຳເລັດຫຍັງສັກຢ່າງ.
Third Example Sentence: ການຮຽນກັບເຮັດວຽກພ້ອມກັນຍາກ ເຫມືອນຈັບປາສອງມື.

Idiom (Lao): ກິນໝາກໄມ້ລືມຄົນປູກ
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Transitive verb clause with complement phrase
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To forget those who helped you succeed.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They are ungrateful and forget their benefactors.
First Example Sentence: ບໍ່ຄວນກິນໝາກໄມ້ລືມຄົນປູກ ເພາະຈະບໍ່ມີໃຜຊ່ວຍອີກ.
Second Example Sentence: ຄົນທີ່ກິນໝາກໄມ້ລືມຄົນປູກ ເຮັດໃຫ້ຄົນອື່ນເສຍໃຈ.
Third Example Sentence: ຄວາມກະຕັນຍູເປັນຄຸນທີ່ດີ ຢ່າກິນໝາກໄມ້ລືມຄົນປູກ.

Idiom (Lao): ໄຟໃກ້ນ້ຳໄກ
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Juxtaposed noun phrase with contrastive metaphor
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Describes a relationship or situation that cannot coexist peacefully.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They are incompatible or always in conflict.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional image from Lao folktales contrasting natural opposites.
First Example Sentence: ສອງຄົນນັ້ນເຫມືອນໄຟໃກ້ນ້ຳໄກ ຢູ່ດ້ວຍກັນບໍ່ໄດ້.
Second Example Sentence: ບໍ່ມີຄວາມສົມພອດ ເຫມືອນໄຟໃກ້ນ້ຳໄກ.
Third Example Sentence: ຄູ່ຜົວເມຍບາງຄູ່ເປັນໄຟໃກ້ນ້ຳໄກ ທະເລາະກັນປະຈຳ.

Idiom (Lao): ແມງວັນກັບນ້ຳຕານ
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Noun phrase expressing attraction through metaphor
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To be irresistibly drawn to something even if it may be harmful.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They are attracted to danger or temptation.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: From natural observation; flies drawn to sweetness symbolize dangerous attraction.
First Example Sentence: ລາວໄປຫາຄົນນັ້ນທຸກມື້ ເຫມືອນແມງວັນກັບນ້ຳຕານ.
Second Example Sentence: ຄວາມຮັກຂອງເຂົາເປັນເຫມືອນແມງວັນກັບນ້ຳຕານ ທັງໆທີ່ຮູ້ວ່າຈະເຈັບ.
Third Example Sentence: ເຂົາຫາອັນຕະລາຍດ້ວຍຄວາມຢາກເຫມືອນແມງວັນກັບນ້ຳຕານ.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To be relieved from a difficult situation.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They escaped from a problem or burden.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from the imagery of fish returning to water, symbolizing freedom.
First Example Sentence: ຫຼັງຈາກໄດ້ຮັບຄຳຕອບ ລາວຮູ້ສຶກເຫມືອນປາຫຼົດນ້ຳ.
Second Example Sentence: ພວກເຮົາໄດ້ຈົບງານແລ້ວ ເຫມືອນປາຫຼົດນ້ຳຈິງໆ.
Third Example Sentence: ເມື່ອພົບທາງອອກ ລາວຢິ້ມເຫມືອນປາຫຼົດນ້ຳ.

Idiom (Lao): ໄກ່ເຫັນຕີນງູ ງູເຫັນນົກໄກ່
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To mutually expose each other's secrets or faults.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They both know each other’s flaws.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Classic Lao proverb; metaphor for mutual understanding or deception.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Lao): /káj hěn tiːn ŋuː ŋuː hěn nòk káj/
First Example Sentence: ສອງຄົນນັ້ນເຫມືອນໄກ່ເຫັນຕີນງູ ງູເຫັນນົກໄກ່ ຮູ້ກັນຫມົດ.
Second Example Sentence: ການເມືອງບາງຄັ້ງກໍເປັນໄກ່ເຫັນຕີນງູ ງູເຫັນນົກໄກ່.
Third Example Sentence: ເຮືອນນັ້ນບໍ່ມີຄວາມລັບເພາະໄກ່ເຫັນຕີນງູ ງູເຫັນນົກໄກ່.

Idiom (Lao): ເຈົ້າໄດ້ໃຈ ຂ້ອຍໄດ້ຈົນ
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To express injustice or uneven gain between people.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Popular Lao saying highlighting economic inequality.
First Example Sentence: ໃນການແຂ່ງຂັນນີ້ ເຈົ້າໄດ້ໃຈ ຂ້ອຍໄດ້ຈົນ.
Second Example Sentence: ທຸກຄັ້ງທີ່ເຮັດວຽກນຳລາວ ເຫມືອນເຈົ້າໄດ້ໃຈ ຂ້ອຍໄດ້ຈົນ.
Third Example Sentence: ສັງຄົມບາງຄັ້ງເຮັດໃຫ້ຮູ້ສຶກເຫມືອນເຈົ້າໄດ້ໃຈ ຂ້ອຍໄດ້ຈົນ.

Idiom (Lao): ສຸດທ້າຍໄຟເຜົາເຮືອນຕົວເອງ
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To cause one’s own downfall through one’s actions.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They destroyed themselves through their behavior.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional moral imagery in Lao Buddhist literature.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Lao): /sút tʰáːj fáj pʰǎw hɯːan tùa ʔeŋ/
First Example Sentence: ຄົນທີ່ເຮັດຊົ່ວ ສຸດທ້າຍໄຟເຜົາເຮືອນຕົວເອງ.
Second Example Sentence: ຜູ້ນຳບາງຄົນສຸດທ້າຍໄຟເຜົາເຮືອນຕົວເອງຈາກຄວາມໂກງ.
Third Example Sentence: ຢ່າໃຫ້ຄວາມໂກດທຳໃຫ້ເປັນໄຟເຜົາເຮືອນຕົວເອງ.
